intro: Hybanthus heterosepalus, commonly known as the zigzag flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Bindweed family (Convolvulaceae) and is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish in color. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with a slightly hairy surface. Hybanthus heterosepalus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
